body:
In Fetcher.java, you'll notice that I didn't convert all the metrics over to the new way. In particular, I didn't convert over the per-partition lag metrics, in function recordPartitionLag(), that were added in KIP-92 (https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-92+-+Add+per+partition+lag+metrics+to+KafkaConsumer)

The reason I couldn't convert those over is that the MBean attribute has the topic/partition name in it. As far as I know, this is the only MBean attribute where it varies by topic/partition. In all the other JMX MBeans, the MBean *name* might sometimes have a topic or partition in it, but the attributes are always fixed.

IMO, the metric names in KIP-92 should be named differently. They are currently,

```
mbean: kafka.consumer:type=consumer-fetch-manager-metrics,client-id={client-id}
attributes:
    topic-partition.record-lag
    topic-partition.record-lag-avg
    topic-partition.record-lag-max
```
I think they should instead be called
```
mbean: kafka.consumer:type=consumer-fetch-manager-metrics,client-id={client-id},topic={topic},partition={partition}
attributes:
    record-lag
    record-lag-avg
    record-lag-max
```

I'm not sure what to do about that. I can still include them in the docs, but the actual code will diverge from the docs then. (Meaning, the metric docs and definition will exist in two different places)

I attached a screenshot of what the generated docs will look like, on the JIRA. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-5191

I'm not sure how to implement this component of the KIP that deals with defaults:
```
This config [reconnect.backoff.max.ms] will default to 1000ms if `reconnect.backoff` is not set explicitly. Otherwise, it will default to the same value as `reconnect.backoff`.
```

@dpkp, implementing a default that is based on whether the user has set another config is a bit annoying. To check if the user set a config, `config.originals()` can be used. Maybe we can introduce a helper method in `CommonClientConfigs` that takes an `AbstractConfig` and returns the value of `reconnect.backoff.max.ms`.

@davispw It depends how you look at it. Note, that Schema Registry is not part of AK, but an open source offer from Confluent. Thus, from an AK point of view, it is a HOTFIX as it does not impact AK. That is also the reason why it's not part of release notes.

@mjsax yes, I tested all the streams test in an ultra-low resource environment (1 wimpy core, 1GB of RAM) and even with the RocksDB fix the queryOnRebalance test would fail. Sometimes the network would appear flaky, requiring more retries (I've changed to 10). Sometimes the rebalance would take forever, requiring new timeouts.
cc @guozhangwang

Also there are a couple of PRs ongoing that may change `TransactionalCoordinator` class as well, so your PR may need to be rebased after those commits, just a heads up :)
